author: MICHELANGELO RUCCI
title: Port Adelaide Crows pay tribute to Phil Walsh in derby with one-off medal for Showdown’s best player |
text:
PHIL Walsh’s name will be honoured with a one-off award to the best player in Showdown 39 at Adelaide Oval on Sunday.
The regular “Showdown Medal” will be put aside for the Port Adelaide-Crows derby to pay tribute to Walsh, who died at his Somerton Park home on July 3.
The medal is part of dedicating Sunday’s Showdown to Walsh, who is a life member at the Port Adelaide Football Club for his services across 11 seasons in two stints as an assistant coach and was the Crows’ senior coach this season. The Phil Walsh Medal. Source: The Advertiser
Port Adelaide chief executive Keith Thomas and his Crows counterpart Andrew Fagan announced the one-off award — and details of how Walsh’s influence at both clubs would be celebrated on Sunday — at Adelaide Oval this afternoon, a day after the memorial service to Walsh at the same venue.
Memorial to Phil Walsh
Earlier it was confirmed the competing teams would share the same run-through banner in the lead-up to the 2.50pm start to the Showdown.
As the host club, Port Adelaide is charged with the running sheet for the derby. In co-ordination with Adelaide, the Power has decided:
The regular “March from the Mall” will begin at 1.30pm with an open invitation to Crows fans to join the Power supporters in their united entry to the Oval. Outside Adelaide Oval during the memorial held for Phil Walsh. Source: Getty Images
Each club will have its theme songs played as they take the field.
A special version of the Power’s “Never Tear Us Apart” anthem will be played in the 60 seconds before the first bounce to honour Walsh’s time at both clubs.
At the end of the game the winning club’s theme song will not be played. Both teams will unite for the presentation of the Showdown Trophy and the Phil Walsh Medal followed by a minute’s applause as a final mark of respect to Walsh. AFL 360 (15/7/15) 48:27 Play video
AFL: Join Gerard Whately and Mike Sheahan for a special edition of AFL 360 following the memorial of Phil Walsh.
Fox Sports 16 Jul 2015 Sport/AFL/Shows/AFL 360 Thomas says the AFL clubs want a celebration of Walsh’s life to mark Showdown 39.
“The amount of support that both clubs have received from each other over the past couple of weeks has been extraordinary and it’s great to able to continue that theme into Sunday’s Showdown,” Thomas said.
“From a supporter perspective, Port Adelaide is encouraging Crows fans to join our people on our traditional ‘March from the Mall’.
“And then for both teams to run through a joint banner is extremely significant and something which we may never see again.
“There’ll be some very special moments across the day including Never Tear Us Apart and the minute’s applause to conclude the afternoon.
“Rest assured though that in between these tributes both sides will be smashing into each other hell-bent on victory as only ‘Walshy’ would have wanted and expected.”
